task.title: Installing the DITA For Publishers Package

context.p: The DITA For Publishers materials are provided as a single Zip package from the project's download page: https://sourceforge.net/projects/dita4publishers/files/. The Toolkit plugins are intended for use with the 1.6, 1.7, and 1.8 versions of the Open Toolkit but may work with the 1.4.3 version. The DITA for Publishers plugins are tested against the latest stable and milestone releases. Open Toolkit 1.6.3 is the oldest version I would recommend using. The D4P transforms may work with 1.5.4 but are not guaranteed to do so.

step.cmd: Download the Zip package and unpack it wherever you like, e.g. c:\myprojects\dita4publishers.

stepresult.p:
You should get these directories and zip files:
dita4publishers_toolkit_plugins-version-release-modification.zip Contains the DITA for Publishers Toolkit plugins. To be installed in your local Open Toolkit's plugins directory.
documentation Contains the project documentation (DITA format).
sample_data Contains sample publications and related data that serve to demonstrate and test the Publishing vocabulary modules.
xslt Contains various XSLT transforms that might be useful, mostly used to convert Project Gutenberg sample data into publications (the XSLTs used by plugins are in the plugins as packaged).

step.cmd: Unzip the file dita4publishers_toolkit_plugins into your local Open Toolkit's plugins directory so that each top-level directory in the Zip file is a direct child of plugins.

stepresult.p:
Your plugins directory should include a number of DITA for Publishers plugin directories, including:
net.sourceforge.dita4publishers.doctypes
net.sourceforge.dita4publishers.epub
net.sourceforge.dita4publishers.kindle
net.sourceforge.dita4publishers.pubmap.html
net.sourceforge.dita4publishers.word2dita
net.sourceforge.dita4publishers.xmldomain.doctypes
net.sourceforge.dita4publishers.xmldomain.html

That should run and you should see some sort of happy message.

note.p: The Open Toolkit that comes installed with OxygenXML does not include Ant in the tools/ant location within the Toolkit because OxygenXML already provides Ant in a different location. As of Oxygen 13.1, Ant is in tools/ant below the main Oxygen installation directory. If you are in a command window with Oxygen's Toolkit as your current directory, you would do this:c:\Program Files\oxygen\frameworks\dita\DITA-OT > ..\..\..\tools\ant\bin\ant -f integrator.xml

step.cmd: Test the toolkit by running the epub generation on one of the sample publications.

info.p: You first need to start a Toolkit-specific command window, which you do by running the command startCmd.bat (Windows) or startCmd.sh (OSX, Linux). This sets up the Java class path so the Toolkit processes will work correctly:c:\DITA-OT > startCmd.bat

Specifying the actual path to where you put the sample data.
For Windows, use backslashes in the filename in the /i parameter:java -jar lib/dost.jar /i:\Users\myname\dita4publishers\sample_data\wizard-of-oz\wizard-of-oz.ditamap /transtype:epub
